website_summaries.verdict: The Arrowood 2 Waterproof from Teva goes above and beyond with its blend of comfort and lightness. Buyers were also left astonished with the shoe’s waterproofness, surface grip, and cushioning. On the other hand, its lack of arch support didn’t leave a good impression on consumers. Taking everything into account, the Teva Arrowood 2 Waterproof still has what it takes to provide a trail-worthy performance, especially in wet environments.
pros: According to a multitude of buyers, the Teva Arrowood 2 Waterproof was very comfortable
Its waterproof liner impressed numerous purchasers by offering protection from wet conditions
Dozens of consumers confirmed that this was a lightweight shoe for hiking adventures
This Teva product offered ample traction on rugged terrain, as testified by a bunch of outdoor enthusiasts
Most wearers said that this footgear didn’t require any break-in
The minority were pleased with the cushioning of this low-top hiker
cons: Several owners did not like the Teva Arrowood 2 Waterproof’s insufficient arch support
A few adventurers were dismayed when the shoe’s sole started to squeak

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes, but too tight for me because I have a bunion
customer_reviews.text: I tried using a shoe stretcher device (purchased separately here at Amazon) to widen the right shoe to accommodate the spot on my right foot where I have a bunion. I left the stretcher in the shoe for 48 hours, but it didn't help. Presumably the problem here is that the waterproof material doesn't stretch. Took these shoes on a vacation trip and wearing the shoe on that foot became painful after a few hours. The shoes look good and they seem well made, so it might be great if you don't have a bunion.
customer_reviews.author: so_many_cds

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy, but the sole is too thin
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits like a glove and my foot feels at home, but (!!!) the sole is very thin, and you're going to feel every bump and stone. Those ARE NOT hiking shoes the manufacturer claims them to be. For a casual stroll to your office, they're great, otherwise - not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Nauarchus V

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Lightweight Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box. Lightweight - like wearing sneakers. Worn them in moderate rain showers and they kept my feet dry. So far, so good! There was a slight colour difference to the leather between the shoes, not enough for me to send them back, but I have deducted one star for that.
customer_reviews.author: CRF Vancouver

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and comfortable right out of the box, but the styling?
customer_reviews.text: These look much better on the website than in person. They were lightweight, immediately comfortable, and well-made. However, they were described by my wife and kids as "old-man shoes". I'm not yet at that stage of life where comfort trumps all else.
customer_reviews.author: K Nellans

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original Arrowwood
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately they stopped producing the men’s original Arrowwood, which I really liked. Figured I’d get these before they went out of production. Turns out they are very comfortable, very light and look like they may last longer than the originals.
customer_reviews.author: MARK J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable nice looking shoe. Great seller as well. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Jim w/ Amsoil

customer_reviews.title: Arrowood 2 - A Great Improvement
customer_reviews.text: As a long time Teva buyer (and lover) Arrowood 2 is an excellent improvement over version 1. The biggest change is that the soles are thicker and tougher. This change was needed and is appreciated. The lacing system is also better. The fit and finish is excellent as is usual for the Arrowoods. Above all, in my experience, Tevas are the only shoes that I have (and I have alot) that are truly Water-Proof! An excellent upgrade and a great shoe! I can't wait to try another pair. Thanks Teva! (one question - where is the Pecan color? I love those.)
customer_reviews.author: PCF

customer_reviews.title: Wanted dry feet....these are the ticket.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my "yard shoes"....we get 200+ inches of rain a year. They look way too nice for walking the dogs or mowing grass... I now wear them to work. I suppose when they get beat up, I can then make them my yard shoes. I will probably order another pair for the original purpose. Comfy so far, a bit warm here in the tropics, but my feet stay dry JT. Hilo, HI
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Walking, not hiking
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable around town, walking on pavement, everyday good looking casual shoe. Not for off road. Only reason for 4 stars not 5 is that they're billed as hiking. If they were honest up front about the lighter construction, it would be 5. I love the shoes, but I would not take them on a 5 mile trail hike. Teva has another shoe for that, which i also own, and love.
customer_reviews.author: Mocat

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Shoes !  Versatile, Comfy ... ... Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The Good : - Waterproof ( Event or TIDE ? ) - Very comfortable right out of box - Lightweight - Good cushioning - Improved insole quality then Arrowood ( 1 ) - Good traction both dry & wet places - Well fit ( after 1/2 size up ) - Stylish - Great for city life too - Improved laces system - The price was awesome, thanks Amazon. The Bad : - Will be a bit warm in hot summer
customer_reviews.author: Sygate

customer_reviews.title: Only shoes I wear
customer_reviews.text: First I’ll say Teva is my favorite shoe brand. It probably sounds like these shoes are too big for me. I have serious foot issues and these are my constant winter companions. The wide toe box is extremely comfortable for my messed up toes. I have narrow feet and these tie just right around my sore instep and hug my heels perfectly. And yes, they really are waterproof. I like the way they look, too. I don’t have many shoe choices and these are #1. I love Amazon Wardrobe for shoes. I can actually wear them around the house until I’m sure they are right. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: CindyCK

customer_reviews.title: Misleading listing. Ordered a size 7, received a men’s size 7.
customer_reviews.text: This listing is stated as being a women’s shoe, so ordered a size 7 thinking it would be a women’s size 7. What I received was a men’s size 7. I am usually a 7.5 women’s and decided to keep these even though they are quite large on me, because I need them for a trip in a couple days. They are okay with a pair of thick socks. But please be more specific in the listing! Disappointed and feel a bit mislead, wouldn’t have ordered if I knew it was actually a men’s shoe. That being said the shoe is very nice, lightweight, with good support.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Shoes
customer_reviews.text: An excellent shoe, comfortable and good looking. I haven't had to test their waterproofness yet because the weather has been unusually dry but I have faith in this brand. If I were to do it over, I might go up a half size so they could be worn with heavy socks, but overall, seems to be exactly a 9-1/2, as they are comfy with thin, or no socks. I'll be wearing these a lot this winter. As usual, updates will be made as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chiabatta

customer_reviews.title: FIRST WEEK
customer_reviews.text: i have tried them only a week .. so far they are very comfortable .... not sure if they are %100 waterproof though....but they are really really very comfortable.... UPDATE after a year....; still 5 stars...waterproof works walking in the rain on the grass and still having dry socks...laces didn't last long , i got lock lace and it is wayyy better than the original laces..
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but soles are very slippery and no wide widths
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight - More sporty than some of the hiking shoes Cons: - Very slippery soles on some flat/slick surfaces, could do a 360 spinning in these several times. - No sport laces - Not offered in wide widths
customer_reviews.author: JeffA

customer_reviews.title: Great wet weather walking/hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes just before taking a month-long trip to England/Scotland/Wales/Ireland in preparation for rainy days. I used the Amazon Wardrobe facility to order this in two sizes plus I included 3 other similar shoes for comparison. I hardly had time to break them in before the trip but they were comfortable right out of the box. In England we got lost hiking in the Peak District - total of 6 miles and up/down 3000 feet twice. No issues whatsoever! Used them about every other day on the trip (yep, it does rain quite a bit over there!)
customer_reviews.author: Ken D.

customer_reviews.title: Really Comfortable, Not Waterproof Enough
customer_reviews.text: My normal size (13) was too tight so I went up to 14, which provided the room I needed. These shoes are very comfortable all day long. But after being out in the rain today, my socks had a few wet spots. Not dramatic. Just damp. Still, if you represent a product as waterproof, it would be good if it really was.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Sternberg

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review on behalf of my husband. He loves these shoes! They fit perfect and are super comfortable. He has a wide foot and this has space for him. He is on his second pair for a variety in color. He wears his shoes really hard, so most of the time they fall apart, but each pair he has owned has not fallen apart!
customer_reviews.author: Wenzel's Wayside

customer_reviews.title: Not very waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on April 7 and by May 16th the shoes were leaking. Ive had much cheaper shoes last longer with simple protection. Additionally the right shoe was warped from poor packaging, and took a week of wear to be comfortable. The high back of the shoe also required me to purchase new socks to help stop the rubbing on my ankle. Styling is good, but they are neither comfortable or functional and should not be marketed as a hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: wil

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son, he does a lot of urban walking. We live in Idaho and he says these are super comfortable, warm and dry, even in 10 degree December temperatures. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Brown

customer_reviews.title: Second pair. Definitely buying again in the future.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! This is my second pair of Tevas. Absolutely would buy these again. The color grey is spot on for my opinion of what grey looks like. Havent tested the water proofing but my last pair was and is still proofed.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Renner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: my second pair. I have dogs and walk in wet grass, so dislike wet socks. These are like sneakers and lightweight. They seem to lose their water resistance with time, but much better than sneakers. Good support. Will buy again next winter if available.
customer_reviews.author: Ken David

customer_reviews.title: Execellent support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I started with one pair of Teva shoes and having experienced their comfort, support and quality I've become a real Teva fan. As a result I've purchased other Teva shoe offerings as well. This particular shoe is great just like the others. One note is that they do tend to run small so I'd order 1/2 size larger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Olsson

customer_reviews.title: Quality and understated
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable. No breaking in. The traction is great, but the sole pattern traps dirt like you wouldn't believe. You aren't gonna slip, but you'll want to take them off outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Construction approved.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work during the rain season they have decent traction and are light. Make good shoes for framing roof in the rain. The one the one downside is the material on the bottom of this you it's starting to wear out very quickly within the first week but hey they were meant to be hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Cherno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent l;ooking shoes.  Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: It has not rained in Seattle. Have not got the wet test. Extremely comfortable shoes. I am very happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Corkerstein

customer_reviews.title: Teva
customer_reviews.text: Hope this pair is water tight, as another pair I had was not and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mauree

customer_reviews.title: Great Teva Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Well made and comfortable hiking shoes. They fit great and look to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: St Corr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes, very comfortable right out of the box, no break-in needed. Haven't tested how waterproof they are yet.
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: True to size
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. I am a 9 and 1/2 and purchased the same size. Ready for the wet days on the disc golf course. Update: I've worn my shoes and they are super comfortable and waterproof. Get yourself a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Rapids Dub All-Star

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: We had ordered these shoes earlier, and sent them back, as they were a half size too short. They had said to order the size you usually wear in Tevas, but needed a half size bigger. They are comfortable and will be nice in wet weather.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I love TEVA boots and have several pairs but I was disappointed in these shoes. They were just too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Time Flies

customer_reviews.title: was well received
customer_reviews.text: These were well received and were the second purchase of tevas for my son-in-law. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Edie Manring

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the overall quality of the shoe. It almost is like a leather tennis shoe. Very comfortable, however for hiking I think it would need more support. I have really enjoyed this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Snowskier

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever.
customer_reviews.text: So far these shoes are so perfect, I don't want to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Moore

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable for city walking
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT hiking shoes but are extremely confortable for walking urban distances...
customer_reviews.author: Joey Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if for use outside. Upper parts from sole.
customer_reviews.text: Used daily outside walking in countryside in grass and rocks along streams for about 1 hour. The rubber sole pulled apart from the upper in about a month. No longer waterproof. Worthless for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable, and well made. However, the sole material is soft, and they have worn out VERY quickly... In less than 2 months of semi-regular use, the soles have completely worn and are now dangerous to use for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M. Trejo

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: After walking through dew covered grass my socks and feet are soaked. Otherwise this is a very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lewis

customer_reviews.title: poor quality. sole disassembled itself after walking at the first wet (rain) condition
customer_reviews.text: sole disassembled itself after walking at the first wet (rain) condition
customer_reviews.author: Mikolaj Aleksiejuk

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and durability
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing the shoe in all kinds of challenging weather and has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: James Hawkinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: My husband was so happy to get these and absolutely loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: WATER-PROOF
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these and they are water-proof he said.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and well fitting shoe. Is high quality yet light construction. Love wearing the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color
customer_reviews.text: Color is way off from the site. Walnut shoes more brown online actual product a light tan
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: MENS shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are MENS shoes, that was not clear when I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Always a comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I work in a garden center/ walk about 9-10 miles a day. Watering plants gets shoes wet, these stay dry & comfortable 8+ Hours.
customer_reviews.author: Farmboy75442

customer_reviews.title: Great all round, all weather shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They're water proof and pretty warm. I wore them most of the time during our snow storm in 2019 in Eugene OR and they performed very well. Also I like that I can easily slip them on and off so I don't track dirt in my home or the homes of other. As an extra bonus, I can wear these shoes day in day out without problem. Not something I can do with other shoes. Overall great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard T. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes for my husband for some recent hiking expeditions. Not only were they comfortable, they fit his falling arches supportively. He liked them so much he wore them for the hikes and then for just walking around! What a great shoe and fit!
customer_reviews.author: Toonces mom

product_meta.title: Teva Men's M Arrowood 2 Wp Low Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: With a retuned, featherweight construction featuring FloatLite? technology?plus better breathability and a beefed up rubber outsole for even more grip and protection on rugged terrain?this new, ultralight evolution of our waterproof Arrowood boot steps up to any terrain with an easy, understated style. -Teva?s iconic modern outdoor sneaker is updated to deliver more versatility and improved performance. -Waterproof-leather upper seals out the elements to keep your feet dry -Built with a waterproof membrane that seals out rain, puddles, and other things that splash to keep your feet dry. -Lined with lightweight, breathable mesh that keeps your feet cool and comfortable. -An EVA foam footbed cushions your and softly supports it for all-day comfort. -Our Float-Lite? midsole is super durable and feather light. -Individual rubber outsole pods are strategically placed for superior traction where you need it.
feature_bullets: -Our Float-Lite midsole is super durable and feather light.
-Waterproof-leather upper seals out the elements to keep your feet dry
Teva's iconic modern outdoor sneaker is updated to deliver more versatility and improved performance
-Individual rubber outsole pods are strategically placed for superior traction where you need it.
-Lined with lightweight, breathable mesh that keeps your feet cool and comfortable
